title: Absolute maximum value of a function

content.question: Let f be the function defined by <math> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>ln</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mi>x</mi> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>. What is the absolute maximum value of f ?

choices.label: f does not have an absolute maximum value.

topic.text: 5.2: Extreme Value Theorem, Global Versus Local Extrema, and Critical Points

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
